parts: can you please create a graph representing a 5 year period with the new BGE commercial rate increases

To create a graph representing the new Baltimore Gas and Electric (BGE) commercial rate increases over a 5-year period, I will need specific data regarding the rate increases for each year. Can you provide the annual rate increase percentages or the actual rate values for each year in the 5-year period?

content.text:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Initial rate (assuming a starting point, since the actual starting rate wasn't provided)
initial_rate = 100  # This can be any unit or baseline rate the user has in mind

# Years
years = np.arange(0, 5, 1)  # 5 years

# Calculate rate increases
rates = initial_rate * (1 + 0.03) ** years

# Create the graph
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(years + 1, rates, marker='o', linestyle='-', color='b')  # Adding 1 to years for display purposes (Year 1, Year 2, ...)
plt.title('BGE Commercial Rate Increases Over 5 Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Rate ($)')
plt.xticks(years + 1)  # Ensure years are displayed properly
plt.grid(True)

# Show the graph
plt.show()

Matplotlib is building the font cache; this may take a moment.

parts: Here is a graph representing the BGE commercial rate increases over a 5-year period, assuming a 3% annual increase. The graph starts from an arbitrary initial rate of 100 (this could represent any unit of measurement or monetary value relevant to the commercial rates). Each year, the rate increases by 3%, demonstrating how the commercial rates would evolve over the 5-year period.
